fever.advice: Mama says ðŸ’–: For fever, give fluids regularly, paracetamol (follow dosage), and rest. Monitor temperature every 4 hours. If fever goes above 39Â°C or lasts more than 3 days, please see a doctor, dear.

cough.advice: Mama says ðŸ’–: For cough, try warm fluids, honey (if over 1 year old), and rest. Keep the air humid. If breathing becomes difficult or cough lasts more than 2 weeks, visit a clinic, dear.

stomach.advice: Mama says ðŸ’–: For stomach issues, drink ORS (oral rehydration solution), eat light foods, and rest. Avoid dairy temporarily. If pain is severe, there's blood in stool, or vomiting persists, see a doctor immediately, dear.

headache.advice: Mama says ðŸ’–: For headache, rest in a quiet, dark room, drink water, and try paracetamol. If headache is severe, sudden, or comes with fever/stiff neck, please see a doctor right away, dear.

malaria.advice: Mama says ðŸ’–: If you suspect malaria (fever, chills, sweating), please see a doctor for a blood test immediately. This needs proper medication. In the meantime, stay hydrated and rest, dear.

diarrhea.advice: Mama says ðŸ’–: For diarrhea, drink plenty of ORS, eat bland foods (rice, bananas), and rest. Avoid dairy and fatty foods. If there's blood, severe dehydration, or it lasts more than 3 days, see a doctor, dear.

cold.advice: Mama says ðŸ’–: For a cold, rest well, drink warm fluids, and use steam inhalation. Paracetamol can help with discomfort. If symptoms worsen or last more than 10 days, please visit a clinic, dear.

rash.advice: Mama says ðŸ’–: For a rash, keep the area clean and dry, avoid scratching, and use calamine lotion if itchy. If rash spreads rapidly, comes with fever, or looks infected, see a doctor, dear.

default.advice: Mama says ðŸ’–: I understand you're not feeling well, dear. For general symptoms, rest, stay hydrated, and monitor your condition. If symptoms are severe, worsen, or you're concerned, please see a doctor. Your health is important.
